FuncDef:
The lldp mdn trap-interval command sets the delay time for a device to send alarms about MAC address discovery neighbor (MDN) information changes to an NMS.
The undo lldp mdn trap-interval command restores the default delay time. The lldp mdn trap-interval command sets the delay time for a device to send alarms about MAC address discovery neighbor (MDN) information changes to an NMS. The undo lldp mdn trap-interval command restores the default delay time. The default delay time is 5 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Trap notification interval.
The value is an integer ranging from 5 to 3600, the default is 5s.

ExtraInfo:
After the LLDP alarm function is enabled for a device, the device sends alarms to the NMS when MDN neighbor information changes. If MDN neighbor information changes frequently, the device frequently sends alarms to an NMS, causing network flapping.
You can run this command to set a delay for the device to send alarms about MDN neighbor information changes to the NMS. This command effectively prevents network flapping caused by alarms being frequently sent to the NMS.
